title: Tracking down glyphs in Fontlab
content: Edit-Find or Command-F can help me find glyphs in the font window, but what's the easiest way to track a given glyph down in (a) my classes, and (b) my OpenType code, within Fontlab?
author: eliason

comments.content: I'd like to know this too. I recently had to just wipe all my classes and rebuild them because I could't find a problem glyph somewhere.

Me too!

One thing I've previously resorted to (and some are going to laugh at this) is mark the glyph in question in a really special color, which makes it easy/easier to spot in the Classes window.

Something like a Global Glyph Search function would be awesome.

You can see what classes a given glyph is in by selecting the glyph in the Font window and then click the "Classes..." button on the "Glyph Properties" panel. A window pops up containing a list of all classes on the left and a list of the classes in which the glyph is used on the right. There are buttons that allow you to add or delete the glyph to or from any class.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130320055919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/classes1_5420.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130320055919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/classes2_6540.png)
For tracking down glyphs in OT code, the only way I know of is to copy or export the feature(s) to a text file and search using a text editor.
